results.content: I've listened to several WPF courses and read some books but because I haven't put them into practice, I need refreshers.  This is a good course for me.
results.content_html: I've listened to several WPF courses and read some books but because I haven't put them into practice, I need refreshers. This is a good course for me.

results.content:
I have worked with WPF before and I have an idea of what we are learning. But for a person who has not seen WPF before I think the explanation is very confusing. I mean what is a namespace and why do we need one. I think we are wasting a lot of time looking at the author creating and fixing spelling errors. I suggest you write all the strings in notepad and copy paste as needed. 
Do not say "you can create a window and call it First Window" instead say create a window, call it whatever because I am kind of thinking am I supposed to follow you or am I just looking at what you do. So it is a little unclear to me.
And in the first module, too much reading from the book of things we did not learn yet.
I am hoping that the next module will give me more.

results.content: cours très intéressant et assez complet.dommage que les exemples n'aient pas été préparés en amont. on assiste au debuggage en direct. ça ne fait pas très pro. a part ça l'instructeur connait bien son sujet et l'explique assez clairement

results.content: I liked it, I fumbled a little stopping things until I found them in my VS UI, I don't like the "here is my example" part where he brings forward code he has already written. I looked around for the "download code" but it looks like it may be just available at the end.
